result.execSummary:
The defendant Khai Hoang Do was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Total fines and court costs to be paid during term of probationary period.  Attorney fees in the amount of $573.63 added to amended Judgment of Conviction.  The Department to collect the attorney fees and reimburse Oz Cty Clerk of Courts.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment being entered for the unpaid amount.

Court orders absolute sobriety.  No possession/consumption of any intoxicants.
Defendant is not to be in any casino.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Khai Hoang Do

records.addlTxt: Defendant Khai Hoang Do in court with attorney Michael Girard Penkwitz.  Patti l Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Interpreter Hoanchu Nguyen appears in court.  Counsel submits plea questionnaire and waiver.  Court examines the defendant as to the waiver.  Defendant enters a No Contest plea.  Court accepts the plea, finding it to be free and voluntary, and finds the defendant guilty as to their plea.  Victim makes statements.  State makes recommendation as to sentencing.  Court renders judgment.
Further proceedings on June 15, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Defendant Khai Hoang Do in court with attorney Michael Girard Penkwitz.  Jeffrey A Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Further proceedings scheduled for June 15, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Further proceedings on May 10, 2016 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Khai Hoang Do in court with attorney Michael Girard Penkwitz.  Patti l Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Interpreter Hoanchau Nguyen in court. Interpreter sworn. Counsel waives further reading and enters not guilty plea. Counsel requests status hearing. Copy of signature bond provided to counsel for defendant to review. Defendant states he understands the terms of the bond.  Further proceedings scheduled for May 10, 2016 at 01:15 pm.
State's
State's
Per request of atty Penkwitz - plea hearing adjourned from 3/17 to 4/7.  Copy of notice of hearing mailed to all parties & interpreter.
Adjourned plea hearing on April 7, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
Adjourned plea hearing at 03-17-2016 08:30 am

Attorney Penkwitz accepts appointment as standby counsel. Copy of complaint and signature bond provided to Atty Penkwitz through B2 email as well. Matter adjourned to 3/17/16 at 8:30 am for counsel to have an opportunity to discuss with defendant and interpreter and have pretrial with District Attorney's office.
Adjourned plea hearing at 02-10-2016 08:30 am

Defendant Khai Hoang Do in court.  Patti l Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Interpreter Anh Tran by telephone for defendant. Interpreter sworn in. Defendant does not qualify for public defender representation. Court advises defendant of legal rights. Court needs to look into Vietnamese court forms and sets this over for an adjourned plea hearing. Court will appoint standby counsel to interpret for defendant and assist the court with further hearings.  Adjourned plea hearing scheduled for February 10, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Plea hearing at 01-05-2016 02:30 pm

Defendant Khai Hoang Do in court.  Shannon M. Whitworth appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant has not retained counsel. Court will appoint interpreter.  Plea hearing scheduled for January 5, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
No violent contact with any victim DH or members of household.  No alcohol or controlled substances.

Defendant Khai Hoang Do in court with attorney Matthew E. Weil.  Defendant in custody appearing by video from Ozaukee County Jail. Adam Yale Gerol appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court finds probable cause.   State requests signature bond with conditions.  Defendant will qualify for public defender.  Plea hearing scheduled for November 9, 2015 at 10:00 am.
